articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi
articles.description: Israel is under growing pressure to get more aid into Gaza as the war causes widespread destruction and hunger.
articles.title: More aid trucks expected to roll into Gaza

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy appealed to U.S. President Joe Biden and Chinese leader Xi Jinping on Sunday to join an upcoming peace summit as his country struggles to stave off unrelenting attacks by Russia in its 27-month-old invasion.
articles.title: Zelenskiy, from Kharkiv, urges Biden, Xi to join peace summit

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Leaders from China, Japan, and South Korea will meet for the first three-way talks in four years on Monday in Seoul, as they try to revive trade and security dialogues hampered by global tensions.
articles.title: China's premier to hold rare summit with U.S.-allied South Korea, Japan

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: A senior U.S. lawmaker visiting Taipei on Monday said China's "intimidating" military exercises after Taiwan President Lai Ching-te's inauguration demonstrated China was not interested in taking Taiwan by peaceful means.
articles.title: US lawmaker says China's 'intimidating' military exercises showed no interest in peace

articles.author: Renju Jose
articles.description: Unstable terrain, remote locations and damaged roads are hampering relief efforts in Papua New Guinea after more than 670 people were feared killed in a landslide last week in the Pacific nation's north, the United Nations said on Monday.
articles.title: UN says terrain, remote location hamper relief after landslide buries hundreds in PNG

articles.author: Ruma Paul, Subrata Nag Choudhury
articles.description: Strong winds and heavy rain pounded the coastal regions of Bangladesh and India as severe cyclone Remal made landfall late on Sunday, leaving millions without electricity after power poles fell and some trees were uprooted by gusty winds.
articles.title: Millions without power as cyclone Remal pounds Bangladesh and India

articles.author: Julie Steenhuysen, Jennifer Rigby
articles.description: The United States and Europe are taking steps to acquire or manufacture H5N1 bird flu vaccines that could be used to protect at-risk poultry and dairy workers, veterinarians and lab technicians, government officials said, moves influenza experts say could curb the threat of a pandemic.
articles.title: US, European nations consider vaccinating workers exposed to bird flu

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: A Thai court on Monday sentenced opposition lawmaker Chonthicha Jangrew to two years in prison on Monday for insulting the monarchy, her lawyer said, over a speech she made three years ago at an anti-government protest.
articles.title: Thai opposition lawmaker sentenced to 2 years in jail for insulting monarchy

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Seven more mobile force units will soon arrive as reinforcements in New Caledonia, the Elysée said in a statement on Monday, also indicating a state of emergency would end as planned in the French Pacific territory on Tuesday morning local time.
articles.title: New Caledonia state of emergency to be lifted, says Paris

articles.author: Andrius Sytas
articles.description: Gitanas Nauseda's backing in his bid for a second term could be highest in the country since it split from the Soviet Union.
articles.title: Lithuanian Nauseda calls victory in presidential election
